removals.reasoning: The outer parentheses around the cast expression are redundant in an argument position. The cast itself requires parentheses around the type but not around the whole expression.
Same as above: remove the redundant outer parentheses around the cast.
Redundant outer parentheses around a cast in a function call; (double*)A is sufficient and clearer.
Redundant outer parentheses around a cast in a function call.
Redundant outer parentheses around the cast when passing as an argument to print_array.
The outer parentheses surrounding the cast expression are unnecessary for the free() call; leaving the cast expressions intact is sufficient.
Same as above for B: remove the redundant outer parentheses around the nested casts.

Parentheses around the entire RHS are unnecessary; keep parentheses around the numerator so addition happens before division. The parentheses around the variable in the cast (e.g. (i)) are redundant: use (double)i and (double)n.
Same as the previous line: remove unnecessary outer parens and unnecessary parens around the casted variables, while preserving the numerator grouping.

Parentheses around the inner (num + factor) are unnecessary because the grouping (num + factor - 1) is sufficient as the numerator; keeping parentheses around the numerator ensures correct order of operations while removing the redundant inner pair improves readability.
In the comparison i < (n - 1) the parentheses around the subtraction are redundant: i < n - 1 is parsed as i < (n - 1) due to operator precedence, so the parens can be removed.
The outer parentheses around the cast are redundant. The address-of expression doesn't need its own parentheses; (uint8_t*)&gridA_packed is clearer and equivalent.
Same simplification for the second memcpy argument: remove redundant outer parentheses and the inner parens around &gridA.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast; (uint8_t*)&blockA_packed is equivalent and clearer.
Same as above: parentheses around &blockA are unnecessary when used with the cast.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast in memcpy; the cast and address-of bind correctly without the extra parens.
Same simplification for the second memcpy argument.
Remove redundant outer parentheses around the cast in memcpy.
Same as above: the parentheses around &blockB are unnecessary with the cast.
Parentheses around a simple identifier used as a function argument are redundant and can be removed for clarity.
Remove redundant parentheses around the identifier passed to fprintf; plain fmt_newline is clearer.
Same as above: parentheses around the identifier are unnecessary.
